name: Arcos da Lapa
address: Cardinal Câmara Square, in the Central Zone of Rio de Janeiro
description: The Lapa Arches, also known as the Carioca Aqueduct, are one of the most famous postcards of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

name: Rio de Janeiro Botanical Garden
address: Rua Jardim Botânico, 1008, Jardim Botânico, Rio de Janeiro
description: The Rio de Janeiro Botanical Garden is one of the most beautiful and important parks in Brazil, located in the southern part of the city. Founded in 1808 by D. João VI, the space is home to a rich diversity of national and international flora, including rare and endangered species.

name: Pedra Bonita
address: Parque Nacional da Tijuca, na Estrada das Canoas, em São Conrado, Rio de Janeiro
description: Pedra Bonita is a famous tourist spot in Tijuca National Park, in Rio de Janeiro. Located at an altitude of about 693 meters, it offers an accessible trail and spectacular panoramic views of landmarks such as Morro Dois Irmãos, Pedra da Gávea and the city of Rio.

name: Copacabana Beach
address: Atlântica avenue, Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro
description: Copacabana Beach, located in Rio de Janeiro, is one of the most iconic beaches in the world. Stretching about 4 kilometers along the Atlantic Ocean, it is known for its vibrant atmosphere, soft golden sands, and the famous black-and-white wave-patterned promenade.

name: Cristo Redentor
address: Parque Nacional da Tijuca, no Alto da Boa Vista, Rio de Janeiro
description: Christ the Redeemer is an iconic statue located atop Corcovado Mountain in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Standing at 38 meters tall, it is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and a symbol of peace and Christianity. Offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city, the statue attracts millions of visitors every year. A true landmark of Brazil!

name: Pão de açucar
address: Urca neighborhood, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
description: Sugarloaf Mountain is a stunning natural landmark in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, famous for its unique granite peak rising 396 meters above the Guanabara Bay. Visitors can take a cable car ride to enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of the city, beaches, and surrounding mountains. It's a must-see attraction and a symbol of Rio's beauty!

name: Rodrigo de Freitas Lake
address: Borges de Medeiros Avenue, in the Lagoa neighborhood, in the South Zone of Rio de Janeiro
description: Rodrigo de Freitas Lagoon is a picturesque lagoon located in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, surrounded by lush greenery and iconic views of the city, including the Christ the Redeemer statue and the mountains. It’s a popular spot for outdoor activities like jogging, cycling, and paddle boating, as well as a peaceful place to relax and enjoy nature.

name: National museum
address: Quinta da Boa Vista - São Cristóvão, Rio de Janeiro
description: The National Museum of Rio de Janeiro, founded in 1818, was one of the oldest and most important scientific and historical institutions in Brazil. Located in the former São Cristóvão Palace, it housed vast collections of natural history, anthropology, and archaeology, including artifacts from ancient Egypt, indigenous cultures, and fossils.
